intro: Aegiphila novofrifurgensis, commonly known as the Chilean shrub, is a perennial plant native to the Andean regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
